title: Sakanwa
author: Sakanwa
content: Though I'm new in the cryptocurrency space,I have been hearing so much about crypto ( Bitcoin precisely) lately even before I got registered on the forum and I had to ask this very question because in three days I've heard and seen people talk and discuss about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general and it prompted my question wanting to know why it has been talked about this much and gaining more acceptance in my local community despite it's restrictions in my country and is it also gaining this much fame in your environment?

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Sakanwa on January 24, 2023, 02:53:48 PMwhy it has been talked about this much and gaining more acceptance in my local community despite it's restrictions in my countryYou tell us — we don't even know what country you're in. Quote from: Sakanwa on January 24, 2023, 02:53:48 PMis it also gaining this much fame in your environment?Not really. The bitcoin/crypto hype peaked in 2021 in the country I'm currently in (Philippines), and I'm pretty certain it's pretty much the same for most parts of the world. Not because we had a good price bounce after all the exchange fiasco doesn't necessarily mean bitcoin is gaining fame.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: its like.. "silver car"once you say it. you see them everywhere on the road. however 10 minutes ago you were not thinking about cars and so you were not looking or recognising or caring about them when they pass you by on the street..over the years i have gone down the same motorway(highway) dozens of times a fortnight. oblivious to my surroundings.then giving a lift to a friend that is obsessed with fishing. he was pointing out al the rivers, and ponds along the motorway. now i cant stop noticing them.. and im not even into fishing but now its like these fishing spots are everywhere i see loads of them on my travels

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: What sort of restrictions have been placed on it. Regulations normally allow things to gain acceptance providing they're not an outright ban (or near one).When were people talking about it? Was that recently due to the last spike or has it been ongoing for a while? If it's more recently, are you sure they weren't already talking about it like franky said?Crypto hype in general has been going on for longer than bitcoin has been a thing imo. Bank security is generally worse than most exchanges that function in cryptocurrency now because of it and a lot of cryptocurrency holders also have more secure assets too because they have no need to trust in anyone else to keep their keys secure (though there'll be people in the market with weaker security too so it's a topic worth researching).

comments.body: Just as other users have said, Bitcoin hype has been there since 2021 when it reach it's all time high of about $60k that's if I'm not wrong.Since I don't know your country I think you alone can answer that question but generally I think the recent hype would be because of the recent rise in the price of Bitcoin because it has been down in the bear market for a long time now and most people would be happily talking about it.Quote from: Sakanwa on January 24, 2023, 02:53:48 PMis it also gaining this much fame in your environment?Yes it is and I've got more people wanting to jump into the industry lately with hopes of catching up with the price rise.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Bitcoin doesn't really have that much fame in my opinion. We hear about it in the media from time to time but I don't consider it "fame" because it doesn't have corresponding adoption and adoption is the only "fame" bitcoin needs or has. We all know bitcoin adoption is still very small globally.As for the reason for whatever amount of "fame" bitcoin has, it is pretty obvious if you ask me. Bitcoin offers a very unique set of utilities that people can not find elsewhere. There is no other currency in the world that can give you financial sovereignty and appreciate in value over long term.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Firstly bitcoin has gain massive recognition not just because it’s the first of its kind but its uniqueness which is classified decentralization. The continuous regularizations by banks or restrictions to the freedom of one’s funds when they want has inclined people to bitcoin. Its features like hedging against inflation also plays a role. But the most important part of its fame is the ability to gain profit by just holding for long. Humans look everywhere to gain profit and that is why even Ponzi schemes get lots of people investing in them. The fud or rather hate by the government has one way or the other spread news about it and this has some investors into picking interest in it, clear example is countries whose its adoption grows after government ban. Lastly the social media which is easily use this days to spread news or stereotypes has one way or the other influence it’s popularity.

Anybody can create any number of accounts on any of these websites (I have one with Binance) and never use it (I don't) and yet be a statistic there. comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Maybe you're from Nigeria or a similar country where Bitcoin is sort of restricted, but it seems that people are actively using it just fine, which leads me to assuming that using it isn't really prosecuted even if it is technically illegal. If your country has strict and enforced anti-crypto legislation, then I'd be surprised if Bitcoin still were popular. In many countries, luckily, Bitcoin isn't banned, and it's either legal or in the gray area, which is basically safe in most cases. So I'd attribute Bitcoin's fame to being a great-performing asset (if you zoom out), being a revolutionary kind of money (the one no authority issues or controls, the one with fixed total supply and without monetary policies set by anyone, and the one you can send internationally without getting banks or anyone else involved), and partly to it not being severely restricted by the authorities of various countries, actually.

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Quote from: Sakanwa on January 24, 2023, 02:53:48 PMThough I'm new in the cryptocurrency space,I have been hearing so much about crypto ( Bitcoin precisely) lately even before I got registered on the forum and I had to ask this very question because in three days I've heard and seen people talk and discuss about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general and it prompted my question wanting to know why it has been talked about this much and gaining more acceptance in my local community despite it's restrictions in my country and is it also gaining this much fame in your environment?Due to the decentralised nature of Bitcoins, no one other than yourself can know how many Bitcoins you have in your wallet. This feature provides the user to manage his finances independently, without having to beg and follow the government or banks. This is the main and primary reason for which Bitcoin has lot many fame. And to counter this many government have banned the coin. Another reason for which many people have interest on Bitcoins is that due to the limited amount of coins. Soon it will become valuable and people will sell it in high price.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: As a human, this is very simple to grasp. When something becomes popular and becomes the talk of the society or community, it is either used for good or used against it. Bitcoin has suffered from both, most notably from black ash and bad press from those who oppose its global implementation as legal tender. One thing you should take away from all of this is that bitcoin is still gaining acceptance around the world, despite the government's opposition. People still believe and trust in it, which should persuade you that bitcoin is worth the good name and fame it carries. Millions of people can't be attached to something if it's not worth it.

Most people that are fifty and above have little or no knowledge about the currency in my locality. This is because people are currently focusing on meeting their basic needs and only a few are considering investments. A good product would always get the right attention, that's why bitcoin would keep attracting more people to its fold.

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: Why is bitcoin gaining this much fame despite its restrictions? Easy… Bitcoin is a life changing innovation that has shaken both the governments of the world as well as the traditional financial institutions. Of course it would attract the curious minded ones and curiosity is a trait that’s in every individual and that’s why it has and is still fast gaining adoption despite restrictions, criticism and outright bans from governments and financial institutions.
